paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Family members including a 15-year-old boy (proband), two sisters, and parents.
patients.phenotype: Only the proband presented with LQTS clinically.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diagnosed with LQTS after presport ECG screening.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband in this study is a healthy 15-year-old boy with no history of syncope diagnosed with LQTS after presport ECG screening.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Had normal QTc at baseline and during exercise.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Sister 2 (KCNH2-A013V) had normal QTc at baseline (0.42 second).

individual_records.phenotype_details: No history of LQTS despite carrying the mutation.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The mother’s genotype, both SCN5A-F1596I and KCNH2-S654G, increased APD90 by approximately 75 ms.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No history of LQTS despite carrying the mutation.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The father/sister hERG-A913V gives an approximately 30-ms prolongation of APD.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Had normal QTc at baseline and during exercise.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Sister 1 (SCN5A-F1596I) had normal QTc at baseline (0.41 second).

functional_data.summary: hERG-S654G showed a distinct loss of function, with tail current density decreased approximately 70%.

variants.segregation_data: The KCNH2-S654G mutation does not segregate with disease in the family as only the proband is affected.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on functional characterization.
variants.additional_notes: The presence of KCNH2-S654G alone is insufficient to cause LQTS without the combination of other mutations.
key_quotes: This combination explains the LQTS seen in the proband, who therefore presents with a polygenic case of LQTS.

patients.demographics: Family members including a 15-year-old boy (proband), two sisters, and parents.
patients.phenotype: Only the proband presented with LQTS clinically.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diagnosed with LQTS after presport ECG screening.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband in this study is a healthy 15-year-old boy with no history of syncope diagnosed with LQTS after presport ECG screening.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Had normal QTc at baseline and during exercise.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Sister 2 (KCNH2-A013V) had normal QTc at baseline (0.42 second).

individual_records.phenotype_details: No history of LQTS despite carrying the mutation.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The mother’s genotype, both SCN5A-F1596I and KCNH2-S654G, increased APD90 by approximately 75 ms.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No history of LQTS despite carrying the mutation.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The father/sister hERG-A913V gives an approximately 30-ms prolongation of APD.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Had normal QTc at baseline and during exercise.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Sister 1 (SCN5A-F1596I) had normal QTc at baseline (0.41 second).

functional_data.summary: hERG-A913V resulted in a 37% decrease in tail current.

variants.segregation_data: The KCNH2-A913V mutation does not segregate with disease in the family as only the proband is affected.
variants.evidence_level: Low evidence based on minor biophysical changes.
variants.additional_notes: The presence of KCNH2-A913V alone is insufficient to cause LQTS without the combination of other mutations.
key_quotes: It seems this mutation alone is insufficient to lead to an LQT phenotype, experimentally and phenotypically.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
